info.game_comments: Alan Dunn game 1. WE ASKED: Dr. Travis Stork.

(1, 1).clue: Pushing the CC button on your car activates this, perfect for long trips on the open highway

(2, 1).clue: The USA's 10 highest mountain peaks are all found in this state

(3, 1).clue: In the expressions sack duty & sack rat, heard in the military, sack means this

(4, 1).clue: These public schools with limited enrollment are named for the special contract that governs them

(6, 1).clue: Bill Russell & this man AKA "The Stilt" didn't talk for 20 years at one point, but ended up fast friends

(1, 2).clue: Sometimes before a TV show, you'll see a "CC" indicating this sort of transcription

(2, 2).clue: This range forms a natural barrier between 2 nations, with a third country among its peaks

(3, 2).clue: As mentioned in the Bible, wearing sackcloth & ashes was a sign of this somber condition

(4, 2).clue: According to its initials, you take the MCAT if you're pursuing a career in this

(6, 2).clue: Shaq is good friends with this diminutive comedian & once picked him up & rocked him like a baby on Leno

(1, 3).clue: When you CC a coworker on an e-mail, "CC" is short for this, representing bygone technology

(2, 3).clue: This mountain rises to some 19,000 feet above the surrounding plains of Tanzania

(3, 3).clue: In the 1912 British play "Hindle Wakes", the line "I'll give him the sack" means this

(4, 3).clue: You can see why Arizona teachers demanding higher pay & more funds used the rhyming slogan this "For Ed"

(5, 3).clue: By E.M. Forster, "Una Habitación con Vistas"

(6, 3).clue: Kevin Durant left OKC, yet his relationship with this Thunder super-guard is "all love at the end of the day"

(1, 4).clue: Though legal, this blackjack strategy got Ben Affleck booted from a casino

(2, 4).clue: Featured in "Peer Gynt", the highest range in Scandinavia is the Jotunheimen Mountains of this country

(3, 4).clue: With his large belly & his never-empty bag, Hotei is one of the mythical gods of this--aptly, there are 7 of them

(4, 4).clue: A hot debate topic: Should teachers be granted this, giving them permanent status & protecting them from dismissal?

(5, 4).clue: "Cincuenta Sombras Liberadas", the third in a series

(6, 4).clue: Dennis Rodman once said of this world leader, "I don't condone what he does, but he's my friend"

(1, 5).clue: After a "La Fille du Regiment" performance, Pavarotti received 17 of them

(2, 5).clue: For the first time in 500 years, this volcanic mountain in the Philippines blew its top in 1991

(3, 5).clue: Part of the ransom paid to free this captured English king in 1194 was 50,000 sacks of wool

(4, 5).clue: Steel yourself: This Pittsburgh university's Tepper School of Business has one of the top online MBA programs

(5, 5).clue: "Por Quién Doblan las Campanas", set in Spain

(6, 5).clue: Kareem Abdul-Jabbar wrote a book about this "50-year friendship" with this UCLA coach

(1, 1).clue: Paul Wolfowitz quit this "World" financial institution in 2007 after a promotion for his girlfriend caused a ruckus

(2, 1).clue: Ask the Pope--you can see the Greek seer Laocoon & his sons grappling with sea serpents at this museum

(3, 1).clue: To translate a language between two speakers in real time

(4, 1).clue: It refers to legal services done for free

(5, 1).clue: "If you're lost, you can look and you will find" this No. 1 hit by Cyndi Lauper

(6, 1).clue: (Travis Stork presents the clue.) Athletes aren't the only ones who can get these injuries caused by the brain banging against the skull--If you experience continued headache, nausea, dizziness, forgetfulness or sensitivity to light & noise after a head impact, get to a doctor

(1, 2).clue: Like Davy Crockett, Sam Houston was a politician in this state, but resigned as gov. in 1829 & ended up in Texas

(2, 2).clue: Some 25,000 years old, the stone statuette Venus of Willendorf is fittingly from this period whose name means "old stone"

(3, 2).clue: From the Latin for "seed plot", it's a conference or college course to learn about a narrow subject

(5, 2).clue: I hope you're having this, the subtitle of Green Day's "Good Riddance"

(6, 2).clue: (Travis Stork presents the clue.) Chronic bending of the spine to look at a phone can cause the painful syndrome known as "text" this; to help treat & prevent it, stand up with your back flat against a wall & perform the "snow angel" exercise

(1, 3).clue: In a 1936 radio address this British king said, "I now quit altogether public affairs & I lay down my burden"

(2, 3).clue: In Victorian England, a plaster one of these was added to a copy of Michelangelo's David

(3, 3).clue: A junior law enforcement officer answering to a sheriff

(4, 3).clue: A decision given per curiam is "by the whole" this

(5, 3).clue: It's the "Rocky Horror" tune about "a jump to the left" & "a step to the right"

(6, 3).clue: (Travis Stork presents the clue.) Heart disease causes 1 in 4 deaths in the U.S each year; to reduce your risk, get active, don't smoke & cut down on processed & prepackaged foods high in this element, symbol Na

(1, 4).clue: In 2000 President Fujimori of this South American country sent his resignation via fax from a Tokyo hotel

(2, 4).clue: A major clue in "Angels & Demons" involves the Bernini statue "The Ecstasy of" this saint of Avila

(3, 4).clue: A square & an equilateral triangle are examples of regular these

(6, 4).clue: (Travis Stork presents the clue.) To help prevent colds & flu get an annual flu shot, keep your distance from infected people & wash your hands before touching these moist membranes that line the eyelids, nose & mouth

(1, 5).clue: Pushing 80, this leader with a hyphenated name resigned as prime minister of Israel in 1963

(2, 5).clue: The blue beastie seen here by Jeff Koons has this simple 2-word title

(3, 5).clue: In a classic Kurt Weill song, "The days grow short when you reach" this month on the calendar

(4, 5).clue: Stare decisis means that this, a past decision in a given area of law, should be respected

(5, 5).clue: "If I could save" this, Jim Croce sang, "The first thing that I'd like to do is to save every day 'til eternity passes"

(6, 5).clue: (Travis Stork presents the clue.) Put away bright phones & computer screens & turn off the lights at bedtime for a good night's rest--darkness stimulates the pineal gland's production of this sleep-inducing hormone

(0, 0).clue: Both "Barnaby Rudge" & this other famous Dickens novel begin in 1775 & deal with mob violence
